subject: Nutrition
title: During Exercise Fueling
description: A quick, practical guide to During Exercise Fueling.

hook.text: Elite cyclists eat 90 grams of carbs per hour racing. For most gym sessions, you need nothing.

buildup.text: Exercise under 60 minutes rarely depletes glycogen enough to need any mid-workout fuel.

discovery.text: Sessions over 90 minutes benefit from 30 to 60 grams of carbs per hour to maintain performance.

twist.text: The gut must be trained to absorb fuel during exercise. Untrained stomachs reject food at high intensity.

climax.text: Elite athletes spend months training their guts to tolerate race-day nutrition strategies.

punchline.text: Train your stomach like you train your muscles.

quiz.question: When does mid-exercise fueling become necessary?
